title: What is sensor used for satellite when satellite is tumbling? - Quora

response.answer_text: The sun sensor is most commonly used as an attitude reference. The sun is bright and easy to detect, so you rotate until you see the sun and then stabilize. The other thing for low earth orbit is a magnetometer. You can do what’s called a Bdot process that attempts to reduce the rate of change of the magnetic field. If you’re reasonably stable, the magnetic field as you orbit changes slowly (except over the poles), so detumbling by minimizing the magnitude of Bdot (the first derivative of the magnetic field vector B) that works fairly well. It’s also handy because you can use magnetic torquers to generate the torques to do the move.
